2156.verse: وَإِذِ|And when|85|100|564$ٱعْتَزَلْتُمُوهُمْ|you withdraw from them|181|211|10641$وَمَا|and what|82|112|46$يَعْبُدُونَ|they worship|105|135|8757$إِلَّا|except|65|95|86$ٱللَّهَ|Allah,|56|71|184$فَأْوُۥٓاْ|then retreat|101|108|10642$إِلَى|to|53|67|118$ٱلْكَهْفِ|the cave.|85|99|10620$يَنشُرْ|Will spread|91|105|10643$لَكُمْ|for you|67|81|207$رَبُّكُم|your Lord|82|96|3243$مِّن|of|50|64|53$رَّحْمَتِهِۦ|His Mercy|98|105|6470$وَيُهَيِّئْ|and will facilitate|132|162|10644$لَكُم|for you|67|126|207$مِّنْ|[from]|61|120|53$أَمْرِكُم|your affair|88|148|10645$مِّرْفَقًا|(in) ease."|89|119|10646$

2157.verse: ۞ وَتَرَى|And you (might) have seen|200|213|5095$ٱلشَّمْسَ|the sun,|90|116|5758$إِذَا|when|55|81|1370$طَلَعَت|it rose,|82|108|10647$تَّزَٲوَرُ|inclining away|112|138|10648$عَن|from|54|67|1105$كَهْفِهِمْ|their cave|87|94|10649$ذَاتَ|to|61|75|7127$ٱلْيَمِينِ|the right,|82|96|9978$وَإِذَا|and when|84|98|96$غَرَبَت|it set,|84|98|10650$تَّقْرِضُهُمْ|passing away from them|181|195|10651$ذَاتَ|to|61|68|7127$ٱلشِّمَالِ|the left|87|98|10652$وَهُمْ|while they|88|110|256$فِى|(lay) in|67|89|89$فَجْوَةٍ|the open space|123|145|10653$مِّنْهُ‌ۚ|thereof.|73|95|571$ذَٲلِكَ|That|64|86|28$مِنْ|(was) from|92|103|53$ءَايَـٰتِ|(the) Signs|94|109|2041$ٱللَّهِ‌ۗ|(of) Allah.|86|117|2$مَن|Whoever|78|109|76$يَهْدِ ٱللَّهُ|Allah guides|98|129|7012$فَهُوَ|and he|65|96|1591$ٱلْمُهْتَدِ‌ۖ|(is) the guided one,|151|166|10551$وَمَن|and whoever|105|118|1012$يُضْلِلْ|He lets go astray|134|160|7014$فَلَن|then never|92|118|768$تَجِدَ|you will find|98|124|4073$لَهُۥ|for him|65|91|977$وَلِيًّا|a protector,|100|113|4037$مُّرْشِدًا|a guide.|84|84|10654$

2158.verse: وَتَحْسَبُهُمْ|And you (would) think them|204|214|10655$أَيْقَاظًا|awake|76|97|10656$وَهُمْ|while they|88|109|256$رُقُودٌ‌ۚ|(were) asleep.|116|137|10657$وَنُقَلِّبُهُمْ|And We turned them|157|168|10658$ذَاتَ|to|61|69|7127$ٱلْيَمِينِ|the right|80|96|9978$وَذَاتَ|and to|75|91|10659$ٱلشِّمَالِ‌ۖ|the left,|87|103|10652$وَكَلْبُهُم|while their dog|117|133|10660$بَـٰسِطٌ|stretched|84|100|10661$ذِرَاعَيْهِ|his two forelegs|125|133|10662$بِٱلْوَصِيدِ‌ۚ|at the entrance.|130|142|10663$لَوِ|If|41|64|7611$ٱطَّلَعْتَ|you had looked|120|143|10664$عَلَيْهِمْ|at them,|77|100|22$لَوَلَّيْتَ|you (would) have surely turned back|264|276|10665$مِنْهُمْ|from them|87|94|730$فِرَارًا|(in) flight|81|95|10666$وَلَمُلِئْتَ|and surely you would have been filled|269|283|10667$مِنْهُمْ|by them|74|88|730$رُعْبًا|(with) terror.|107|114|10668$

2159.verse: وَكَذَٲلِكَ|And similarly,|106|113|1273$بَعَثْنَـٰهُمْ|We raised them|123|137|10628$لِيَتَسَآءَلُواْ|that they might question|185|199|10669$بَيْنَهُمْ‌ۚ|among them.|106|120|1056$قَالَ|Said|52|66|309$قَآئِلٌ|a speaker|84|91|8833$مِّنْهُمْ|among them,|106|114|730$كَمْ|"How long|85|101|1840$لَبِثْتُمْ‌ۖ|have you remained?"|157|173|10402$قَالُواْ|They said,|89|105|101$لَبِثْنَا|"We have remained|147|163|10670$يَوْمًا|a day|62|70|468$أَوْ|or|41|54|154$بَعْضَ|a part|76|103|2330$يَوْمٍ‌ۚ|(of) a day."|97|124|2331$قَالُواْ|They said,|89|116|101$رَبُّكُمْ|"Your Lord|88|115|3243$أَعْلَمُ|knows best|95|122|324$بِمَا|how long|79|92|43$لَبِثْتُمْ|you have remained.|150|167|10402$فَٱبْعَثُوٓاْ|So send|86|120|3972$أَحَدَكُم|one of you|91|126|10671$بِوَرِقِكُمْ هَـٰذِهِۦٓ|with this silver coin of yours|207|242|10672$إِلَى|to|53|70|118$ٱلْمَدِينَةِ|the city,|86|96|6709$فَلْيَنظُرْ|and let him see|121|141|10673$أَيُّهَآ|which is|73|93|9044$أَزْكَىٰ|the purest|89|109|2052$طَعَامًا|food,|79|99|10674$فَلْيَأْتِكُم|and let him bring to you|178|188|10675$بِرِزْقٍ|provision|79|98|10676$مِّنْهُ|from it,|68|106|571$وَلْيَتَلَطَّفْ|and let him be cautious.|180|218|10677$وَلَا يُشْعِرَنَّ|And let not be aware|160|198|10678$بِكُمْ|about you|87|106|2564$أَحَدًا|anyone."|78|78|4849$

2160.verse: إِنَّهُمْ|"Indeed, [they]|122|135|106$إِن|if|44|70|225$يَظْهَرُواْ|they come to know|148|174|7429$عَلَيْكُمْ|about you,|92|118|416$يَرْجُمُوكُمْ|they will stone you|146|172|10679$أَوْ|or|41|54|154$يُعِيدُوكُمْ|return you|98|105|10680$فِى|to|48|62|89$مِلَّتِهِمْ|their religion.|106|120|10681$وَلَن|And never|87|101|229$تُفْلِحُوٓاْ|will you succeed|129|143|10682$إِذًا|then -|62|76|1317$أَبَدًا|ever."|59|66|4093$

2156.verse: [The youths said to one another], "And when you have withdrawn from them and that which they worship other than Allah, retreat to the cave. Your Lord will spread out for you of His mercy and will prepare for you from your affair facility."

2157.verse: And [had you been present], you would see the sun when it rose, inclining away from their cave on the right, and when it set, passing away from them on the left, while they were [laying] within an open space thereof. That was from the signs of Allah. He whom Allah guides is the [rightly] guided, but he whom He leaves astray - never will you find for him a protecting guide.

2158.verse: And you would think them awake, while they were asleep. And We turned them to the right and to the left, while their dog stretched his forelegs at the entrance. If you had looked at them, you would have turned from them in flight and been filled by them with terror.

2159.verse: And similarly, We awakened them that they might question one another. Said a speaker from among them, "How long have you remained [here]?" They said, "We have remained a day or part of a day." They said, "Your Lord is most knowing of how long you remained. So send one of you with this silver coin of yours to the city and let him look to which is the best of food and bring you provision from it and let him be cautious. And let no one be aware of you.

2160.verse: Indeed, if they come to know of you, they will stone you or return you to their religion. And never would you succeed, then - ever."
